bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, January 1, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 1st, 1890
Mer. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 1st, 1890
Honorable Wm F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the returns and accounts of this Consulate General for the quarter ended December 31st, 1889, as follows:

1 Digest of Invoice Book. 2. Arrivals and departures of American vessels. 3. Record of Notarial services. 4. Summary of business Account for salary. Account for contingent expenses, with abstract and vouchers.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General

Enclosures- 1 Digest of Invoice Book. 2. Arrivals and departures of American vessels. 3. Record Notarial services. 4. Summary of business Account for salary. Account for contingent expenses, with abstract and vouchers
